intro: Centaurea purpurea, commonly known as purple centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its showy purple-blue flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Centaurea purpurea is often found in dry grasslands, rocky areas, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
